abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objectives of reforms in the
            social protection and labor market fields supported by the
            Social Sector Adjustment Credit Project are to: 1) support
            development of institutional and budgetary mechanisms for
            development and prioritization of social protection policy
            and programs in Bosnia-Herzegovina; 2) improve the policy
            framework for generating productive employment
            opportunities; 3) initiate improvements in the impact and
            efficiency of the social safety net, in particular focusing
            programs on the needs of the poorest; and 4) strengthen the
            social statistics base in order to ensure that social policy
            is formulated on a well-informed basis. While the credit is
            an important element of raising the profile of these issues
            in Bosnia-Herzegovina, it is only the first step in tackling
            a large reform agenda. The credit conditionality targets
            those areas where there is adequate progress and
            concreteness in the policy dialogue to date. However, the
            Letter of Development Policy outlines both the short-term
            and medium-term program of social protection reform. Further
            World Bank adjustment support will be dependent on adequate
            progress on the medium-term reform agenda. This project is
            also supported by a companion credit, the Social Sector
            Technical Assistance Credit (report no. 20887).
